fields.Title: BOOKSTORE / BOARD GAME MOUNTAIN
fields.Description: A mountain of different board games.

fields.Title: START
input
noie
Conceptualization: "Books in a *board game* section? Wh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Books in a *board game* section? Who wants to read books!?

fields.Title: You: ""I want to buy the *Suzerainty* gam..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I want to buy the *Suzerainty* game."

fields.Title: You: "Hm, maybe I'm not into all this bin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hm, maybe I'm not into all this binoclard stuff.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Then don't."
fields.Dialogue Text: Then don't.

fields.Title: Jump to: [mountainhub]
You: ""Look at me, who'd want to have chi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Look at me, who'd want to have children with me?"

fields.Title: You: "Anything that really catches my eye..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Anything that really catches my eye?

Plaisance: ""Friends are technically like famil..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Friends are technically like family." She fiddles with her pendant, thinking.

fields.Title: Mountain of Board Games: "A towering mountain of colourful bo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A towering mountain of colourful board game boxes and Wirrâl codices.

fields.Title: You: ""Yes. Kids, friends, chicks. I have..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes. Kids, friends, chicks. I have all those."

Plaisance: ""Lousy auras there!" She shudders...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Lousy auras there!" She shudders. "No, *role-playing games* are popular among those types... you know, who're into those kinds of things. Personally, I don't like it. Not at all!"

fields.Title: Jump to: [mountainhub]
You: "I don't want to think about this."
fields.Dialogue Text: I don't want to think about this.

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""Then you're a lucky man, officer...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Then you're a lucky man, officer. Children are the greatest of treasures..." She fiddles with her pendant, thinking.

fields.Title: You: ""So what about all these 'Wirrâl' t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "So what about all these 'Wirrâl' things?"

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""If you say so." She gives you a cu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "If you say so." She gives you a curious glance. "But you better stay away from those immoral occult rituals."

fields.Title: You: ""I don't feel as if I have any kids.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't feel as if I have any kids."

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""'Raubritter' is a fun game of econ..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "'Raubritter' is a fun game of economic competition, but can get quite intense after a while. We have games for the whole family. You can play with your children!"

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "Nonsense for anemic binoclards!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Nonsense for anemic binoclards!

fields.Title: Jump to: [mountainhub]
Plaisance: ""Wonderful choice, sir." She smiles..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Wonderful choice, sir." She smiles at you. "A wholesome *family* game."

fields.Title: Mountain of Board Games: "There's also a large hardbound tome..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's also a large hardbound tome with intricate cover art: "The Hunters of Katuak: Boreal Creature Compendium," and a pick-your-path adventure gamebook titled "Tales of Wirrâl: Cavern of Velkraag."

fields.Title: Logic: "That price *is* steep, but then it'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That price *is* steep, but then it's a Third Edition Mega-Setting Supplement, so it makes sense.

fields.Title: Mountain of Board Games: "A small mountain of colourful board..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A small mountain of colourful board game boxes. There are numerous types of games for all ages. A lot of shelf space seems to be taken up by Wirrâl-related merchandise.

fields.Title: You: ""Storekeep, what board games do you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Storekeep, what board games do you have here?"

fields.Title: Jump to: [mountainhub]
Mountain of Board Games: "An endless variety of sourcebooks,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: An endless variety of sourcebooks, lorebooks, and codices litter the table. The top-most book is titled "Welkin Compendium, Second Edition."

fields.Title: You: ""I want to buy the *Wirrâl* game.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I want to buy the *Wirrâl* game."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Who are you going to play board gam..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Who are you going to play board games with? Do you have friends or family?

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""Don't be so hard on yourself, sir...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Don't be so hard on yourself, sir. You just need to clean up a bit. And technically, friends are a bit like family." She fiddles her pendant.

fields.Title: Mountain of Board Games: "There's a box that says: "Wirrâl. T..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's a box that says: "Wirrâl. Third Edition Mega-Setting Supplements Module". The side panel notes: "A *fantastique* adventure board game. New maps and miniatures!" A sticker on it displays -- 25 reál.

fields.Title: Tutorial Agent: "You've acquired an interactable ite..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You've acquired an interactable item. Investigate this item further by going to the INTERACT tab in your INVENTORY.

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""Wonderful board games, sir. 'The V..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Wonderful board games, sir. 'The Viticulturist' is a classic for sure, or perhaps you'd like 'Archipelagos of Insulinde', a very educational game for those interested in geography."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "It certainly feels like whatever yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It certainly feels like whatever you are will die with you.

fields.Title: You: "Look through the pile of Wirrâl-rel..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look through the pile of Wirrâl-related items.

fields.Title: You: "[Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Leave.]

fields.Title: You: "Wow, I have children? A family?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Wow, I have children? A family?

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""For playing with friends I'd recom..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "For playing with friends I'd recommend 'Suzerainty'. It's a civilization-building game where you build a civilization, then set off to brutally colonize and repress other civilizations. It'll cost 12 reál."

fields.Title: You: "Do I have friends? (Look at the lie..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Do I have friends? (Look at the lieutenant.)

fields.Title: Jump to: [mountainhub]
inlandfriendhub
Inland Empire: "Are you actually friends? Or just c..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Are you actually friends? Or just colleagues thrown together by circumstance?

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""I've heard they turn people into o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I've heard they turn people into occult-enthusiasts. That they have rituals, where they try to summon entities. Highly immoral stuff... You can still buy them, though." She looks at the table, crossing her arms.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Mountain of Board Games: "A towering mountain of colourful bo..."]
